com.tinkerpop.blueprints.util.wrappers.event

Class EventTransactionalIndexableGraph<T extends IndexableGraph & TransactionalGraph>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tinkerpop.blueprints.util.wrappers.event.EventGraph<T>
      • com.tinkerpop.blueprints.util.wrappers.event.EventIndexableGraph<T>
        • com.tinkerpop.blueprints.util.wrappers.event.EventTransactionalIndexableGraph<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph, IndexableGraph, TransactionalGraph, WrapperGraph<T>

    public class EventTransactionalIndexableGraph<T extends IndexableGraph & TransactionalGraph>
extends EventIndexableGraph<T>
implements TransactionalGraph, IndexableGraph, WrapperGraph<T>
    The transactional and indexable implementation of EventGraph where events are raised in batch in the order they changes occured to the graph, but only after a successful commit to the underlying graph.
    Author:
    Stephen Mallette

    • Method Detail

      • stopTransaction

        public void stopTransaction(TransactionalGraph.Conclusion conclusion)
        Description copied from interface: TransactionalGraph
        Stop the current transaction. Specify whether the transaction was successful or not. A failing transaction will rollback all updates to before the transaction was started.

        If there is currently no open transaction (i.e. no operations on the graph), then calling this method has no effect other than potentially re-initializing data structures.

        Specified by:
        stopTransaction in interface TransactionalGraph
        Parameters:
        conclusion - whether or not the current transaction was successful

      • commit

        public void commit()
        A commit only fires the event queue on successful operation. If the commit operation to the underlying graph fails, the event queue will not fire and the queue will not be reset.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface TransactionalGraph

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
        A rollback only resets the event queue on successful operation. If the rollback operation to the underlying graph fails, the event queue will not be reset.
        Specified by:
        rollback in interface TransactionalGraph
